courses.customDesc: Choose one of the following: ANT201, or GEOG150.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Sociology Elective (300-400 level) course can go here. Refer to the catalog for course selections.

Any Concentration Approved Elective course can go here.

Select from the following: ES340; ES/WGS 350; POLS310, POLS333, POLS343, POLS419, POLS459, POLS471; PSY310, PSY318, PSY330; PSY/CD 306; SOC305, SOC306, SOC309, SOC310, SOC327, SOC402, SOC406, SOC412; WGS301, WGS401; WGS/RELS 370.

If GE courses are taken for a letter grade and used as concentration electives, additional Free Electives may be required to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. See College Advisor for additional information.

Note: Check Tentative Course Offerings to see when certain classes are available, and plan accordingly.

Any Concentration Approved Elective course can go here.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
